page.title: 04Village Life in Lyddington
page.content: Village life in the eighties is changing,from a mainly agricultural based community to a commuter dormitory, with inhabitants travelling as far as London for numerous trades and professions.Cottages seem to fetch exhorbitant prices because the village has an attractive exclusiveness which appeals.New houseowners have higher expectations of country life than the old style villager.They want stabling and paddocks for their horses and facilities for their children,the conveniences of modern life,but the seclusion and peace of a village.Most people have a car and there is easy access to the mainline stations and motorways.Their lifestyle being mainly out of the village is one reason for the reduction in community meetings. Some are only weekend cottagers.
